content.title: AICTE e-Shodh Sindhu Scheme (eSS)
content.details: Launched by the All India Council for Technical Education, AICTE e-Shodh Sindhu Scheme (eSS) provides subscriptions of e-Resources like Web of Science, Scopus, The American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) and Bentham Science to institutions. The objective is to facilitate access to e-Resource to the students, faculty and researchers, augmenting the culture of research in the institution and overall quality of technical education.
benefits: Subscriptions of e-Resources like Web of Science, Scopus, ASME, ASCE and Bentham Science to institutions.
Initially for one calendar year, renewable for further year on the basis of usage by institute and fulfilments of other essential eligibility criteria.
eligibility: The institute must have a digital library network having internet bandwidth (32 Mbps) and Wi-Fi connectivity with one or more static IP address.

The proposed coordinator must be full-time regular faculty with at least 10 year of experience in teaching and research with publications to his/her credit. The institute should also identify a co-coordinator who must be a faculty with at least 7 year of experience in teaching and research.
The institute must have PG Course in Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Pharmacy, or any discipline depending on the e-Resource applied for.
content.application_process: Download the Application form for E-Shodh Sindhu Scheme, fill in the required information, verify that every page of the application form has signature and stamp of the Institute’s Head, attach all essential documents, and send the Application form along with all the essential documents through registered post/speed post.
documents_required: AICTE's Approval Letter for current year.
National Basketball Association (NBA) Accredited Approval Letter.
Details of number of publications in last three years.
Technical Education Quality Improvement Programme (TEQIP) Documents.
Details of consultancy project completed in last three years.
Details of research project completed in last three years.
Details of professors in the institute.
Proof of usage of e-Resources (for renewal).
Feedback of Principal/ Director, Coordinator, Co-Coordinator and faculty members in prescribed proforma (for renewal).
Request & undertaking for renewal of subscriptions for subsequent year (for renewal).

faqs.question: What is AICTE e-Shodh Sindhu Scheme (eSS) Scheme?
faqs.answer: AICTE e-Shodh Sindhu Scheme (eSS) provides subscriptions of e-Resources like Web of Science, Scopus, ASME, ASCE and Bentham Science to institutions.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

faqs.question: What are the main objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of this scheme is to facilitate access to e-Resource to the students, faculty and researchers, augmenting the culture of research in the institution and overall quality of technical education.

faqs.question: What should be the criteria of the institution?
faqs.answer: The institution should be AICTE approved Government/ Government-aided institutes.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the subscriptions?
When the application will be open?
faqs.answer: Applications are invited in the month of October-November every year.

faqs.question: By whom the subscriptions of e-Resources will be provided?
faqs.answer: The subscriptions of e-Resources under sanctioned project will be provided by the respective vendors to the institutions.

faqs.question: Whether application can be made for renewal of the subscriptions?
faqs.answer: Yes, renewable for further year on the basis of usage by the institute and fulfilments of other essential eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What would the frequency of monitoring for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The usage of e-Resources provided through this Scheme will be reviewed after every three months.

faqs.question: How evaluation of shortlisted proposals will be done?
faqs.answer: The evaluation of shortlisted proposals shall be done by the expert committee.
